trans-unit.source: toc: show Parent: ./index.md Title: Predefined variables ms.ContentId: 3A1C529F-DF6B-470A-9047-2758644C3D95
trans-unit.target: toc: show Parent: ./index.md Title: Predefined variables ms.ContentId: 3A1C529F-DF6B-470A-9047-2758644C3D95

trans-unit.source: Team Build provides a number predefined variables that can be used in configuring your build definition or in your build scripts.
trans-unit.target: Team Build provides a number predefined variables that can be used in configuring your build definition or in your build scripts.

trans-unit.source: There are a number of scopes where the variables are defined:
trans-unit.target: There are a number of scopes where the variables are defined:

trans-unit.source: System Variables - These are generated by the server and the agent and are the same name and concept but potentially different values depending on the host type for the agent.
trans-unit.target: System Variables - These are generated by the server and the agent and are the same name and concept but potentially different values depending on the host type for the agent.

trans-unit.source: For example in Build the System.DefaultWorkingDirectory is the same as Build.SourcesDirectory.
trans-unit.target: For example in Build the System.DefaultWorkingDirectory is the same as Build.SourcesDirectory.

trans-unit.source: In release management it will be the Release.ArtifactsDirectory.
trans-unit.target: In release management it will be the Release.ArtifactsDirectory.

trans-unit.source: Global Build Variables - These are generated by TFBuild on the server side and are sent to the agent as part of the build job.
trans-unit.target: Global Build Variables - These are generated by TFBuild on the server side and are sent to the agent as part of the build job.

trans-unit.source: An example this variable would be Build.BuildNumber
trans-unit.target: An example this variable would be Build.BuildNumber

trans-unit.source: In addition tasks or build scripts can contribute to this collection of variables and they will be available both in the context and in the environment for downstream tasks.
trans-unit.target: In addition tasks or build scripts can contribute to this collection of variables and they will be available both in the context and in the environment for downstream tasks.

trans-unit.source: Agent Build Variables - These are generated on the agent in the scope of a particular build job prior to it starting.
trans-unit.target: Agent Build Variables - These are generated on the agent in the scope of a particular build job prior to it starting.

trans-unit.source: The name of the team project that this build belongs to
trans-unit.target: The name of the team project that this build belongs to

trans-unit.source: The URL of the team foundation server
trans-unit.target: The URL of the team foundation server

trans-unit.source: The URL of the team foundation collection
trans-unit.target: The URL of the team foundation collection

trans-unit.source: The guid id of the team foundation collection
trans-unit.target: The guid id of the team foundation collection

trans-unit.source: The default working directory for this job. In Build this is Build.SourcesDirectory. In Release this is Release.ArtifactsDirectory
trans-unit.target: The default working directory for this job. In Build this is Build.SourcesDirectory. In Release this is Release.ArtifactsDirectory

trans-unit.source: The name of the Build Definition the current build belongs to
trans-unit.target: The name of the Build Definition the current build belongs to

trans-unit.source: The version of the Build Definition the current build belongs to
trans-unit.target: The version of the Build Definition the current build belongs to

trans-unit.source: The build number assigned to the build by TFS using the build number format specified.
trans-unit.target: The build number assigned to the build by TFS using the build number format specified.

trans-unit.source: The Id of the build record
trans-unit.target: The Id of the build record

trans-unit.source: The identity of the user who queued the build.
trans-unit.target: The identity of the user who queued the build.

trans-unit.source: In the case of CI and Scheduled this will simply be the system identity
trans-unit.target: In the case of CI and Scheduled this will simply be the system identity

trans-unit.source: For manual this will be the identity of the user who queued the build
trans-unit.target: For manual this will be the identity of the user who queued the build

trans-unit.source: For external triggers it will be the identity used to authenticate to the service
trans-unit.target: For external triggers it will be the identity used to authenticate to the service

trans-unit.source: The giud id of the user who queued the build.
trans-unit.target: The giud id of the user who queued the build.

trans-unit.source: In the case of CI and Scheduled this will simply be the system identity
trans-unit.target: In the case of CI and Scheduled this will simply be the system identity

trans-unit.source: For manual this will be the identity of the user who queued the build
trans-unit.target: For manual this will be the identity of the user who queued the build

trans-unit.source: For external triggers it will be the identity used to authenticate to the service
trans-unit.target: For external triggers it will be the identity used to authenticate to the service

trans-unit.source: This user the build was requested for. In a CI build this will be the user who performed the check-in that triggered the build.
trans-unit.target: This user the build was requested for. In a CI build this will be the user who performed the check-in that triggered the build.

trans-unit.source: This guid id of the user the build was requested for. In a CI build this will be the user who performed the check-in that triggered the build.
trans-unit.target: This guid id of the user the build was requested for. In a CI build this will be the user who performed the check-in that triggered the build.

trans-unit.source: The latest version control change that is included in this build. This will be version control specific based on the provider. For Git this will the commit ID and for Tfvc this will be the change set number in the format CS1234.
trans-unit.target: The latest version control change that is included in this build. This will be version control specific based on the provider. For Git this will the commit ID and for Tfvc this will be the change set number in the format CS1234.

trans-unit.source: The branch the build was queued for.
trans-unit.target: The branch the build was queued for.

trans-unit.source: For Git this is the name of the branch in the formation refs/heads/master.
trans-unit.target: For Git this is the name of the branch in the formation refs/heads/master.

trans-unit.source: For Tfvc this will be the root server path for the workspace. $/teamproject/branch
trans-unit.target: For Tfvc this will be the root server path for the workspace. $/teamproject/branch

trans-unit.source: The name of the branch the build was queued for.
trans-unit.target: The name of the branch the build was queued for.

trans-unit.source: For Git this is the last path segment in the ref. For example in refs/heads/master the name is master.
trans-unit.target: For Git this is the last path segment in the ref. For example in refs/heads/master the name is master.

trans-unit.source: For Tfvc this will last path segment in the root server path for the workspace. For example in $/teamproject/branch the name is branch
trans-unit.target: For Tfvc this will last path segment in the root server path for the workspace. For example in $/teamproject/branch the name is branch

trans-unit.source: The name of the repository in the build. By default this is the name of the Git repository or the name of the team project in the case of Tfvc.
trans-unit.target: The name of the repository in the build. By default this is the name of the Git repository or the name of the team project in the case of Tfvc.

trans-unit.source: The name of the source provider for the build
trans-unit.target: The name of the source provider for the build

trans-unit.source: TfGit - Git repository hosted in the TFS server
trans-unit.target: TfGit - Git repository hosted in the TFS server

trans-unit.source: Git - Git repository hosted on an external server
trans-unit.target: Git - Git repository hosted on an external server

trans-unit.source: Whether or not to perform an incremental update of the local copy of the sources. In the case of Git we will delete the checkout files always and only delete the .git folder if this is set to true
trans-unit.target: Whether or not to perform an incremental update of the local copy of the sources. In the case of Git we will delete the checkout files always and only delete the .git folder if this is set to true

trans-unit.source: The URL for the repository synced for this build
trans-unit.target: The URL for the repository synced for this build

trans-unit.source: The name of the workspace created for the build.This is only valid for Tfvc.
trans-unit.target: The name of the workspace created for the build.This is only valid for Tfvc.

trans-unit.source: The name of the shelveset to include in this build. This is used for buddy build and code review validation scnarios
trans-unit.target: The name of the shelveset to include in this build. This is used for buddy build and code review validation scnarios

trans-unit.source: Whether or not to checkout submodules.
trans-unit.target: Whether or not to checkout submodules.

trans-unit.source: The name of the agent as it is registered with the pool. This is likely different than the machine name
trans-unit.target: The name of the agent as it is registered with the pool. This is likely different than the machine name

trans-unit.source: The directory the agent is installed into. This contains the agent bits
trans-unit.target: The directory the agent is installed into. This contains the agent bits

trans-unit.source: The root directory for this agent to sync source. By default it is the same as Agent.HomeDirectory
trans-unit.target: The root directory for this agent to sync source. By default it is the same as Agent.HomeDirectory

trans-unit.source: The working directory for this agent. By default $(Agent.RootDirectory)\_work.
trans-unit.target: The working directory for this agent. By default $(Agent.RootDirectory)\_work.

trans-unit.source: The local path on the agent where the sources are syncd to. Will be $(Agent.BuildDirectory)\$(Build.Repository.Name)
trans-unit.target: The local path on the agent where the sources are syncd to. Will be $(Agent.BuildDirectory)\$(Build.Repository.Name)

trans-unit.source: The folder where all sources for the build definition are synced to.Will be $(Agent.BuildDirectory)\$(Build.Repository.Name)
trans-unit.target: The folder where all sources for the build definition are synced to.Will be $(Agent.BuildDirectory)\$(Build.Repository.Name)

trans-unit.source: The local path on the agent where any artifacts are copied to before being pushed to their destination, it will be cleaned up after the files of been copied to the destination. Will be $(Agent.BuildDirectory)\Artifacts
trans-unit.target: The local path on the agent where any artifacts are copied to before being pushed to their destination, it will be cleaned up after the files of been copied to the destination. Will be $(Agent.BuildDirectory)\Artifacts

trans-unit.source: Wellknown directory on disk where you can place build outputs or other temporary data, it will be cleand up between builds. It is $(Agent.BuildDirectory)\Staging
trans-unit.target: Wellknown directory on disk where you can place build outputs or other temporary data, it will be cleand up between builds. It is $(Agent.BuildDirectory)\Staging

trans-unit.source: The local path on the agent where all folders for a given build definition are created. Will be $(Agent.RootDirectory\hash of collection of definitionid and repository URL
trans-unit.target: The local path on the agent where all folders for a given build definition are created. Will be $(Agent.RootDirectory\hash of collection of definitionid and repository URL
